header: IIReinforcement learning framework for weight reduction

images.caption: Figure 3:Parallel coordinates plot comparing hypergraph product base codes (blue) and RL-optimized codes (red) after weight reduction. For each color, 475 codes(including 10 high-distance ones beyond the HGP-30 regime)with varying parameters are shown. Each vertical axis is normalized to the maximum observed value for that parameter, and each line traces a single code’s parameters across all axes.

Figure 4:Comparisons of codes discovered by our RL-based scheme and existing weight reduction methods. (top) Comparison with Hastings[45](data taken from Ref.[46]) and SOTA results from Sabo et al.[46]. (bottom) Comparisons with SOTA results on all hypergraph product codes constructed fromn≤30𝑛30n\leq 30italic_n ≤ 30classical codes. Explicit code parameters are shown in Table1,2.

Figure 8:Minimum qubit overheads under relaxed distance constraints. Permitting the distanced𝑑ditalic_dto decrease can reduce the total qubit overhead.Code parameters are shown in Table4
